title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Digital Graphic Designer** 

**Location**: Bridgewater, NJ (Hybrid Role)

**Hourly Rate** $30 - $35

**About Blue Craze Media:** 

At Blue Craze Media, we are a passionate team dedicated to driving results for our clients through innovative digital marketing solutions. With our foundation in performance marketing, we leverage the power of data, creativity, and cutting-edge technology to craft campaigns that resonate. Our focus is not just on clicks or impressions; we aim to foster genuine connections between brands and their audiences. As we continue on our path of growth and innovation, we're seeking a Graphic Designer who shares our vision and enthusiasm for the digital landscape.

**Key Responsibilities:** 

● Social Media Content Creation: Design and produce visually engaging content for BCM and clients that ensures alignment with brand ethos and aesthetic.

● Collateral Design: Develop compelling and informative collateral based on client goals and established content strategy, pulling from print and digital design best practices.

● Email Marketing Campaigns: Collaborate with our marketing team to design and launch actionable and measurable email campaigns that educate, captivate and convert leads into clients.

● Experience with design software:

○ Illustrator

○ InDesign

○ Photoshop

○ Premiere Pro

● Copywriting: Draft and fine-tune captivating copy for social media posts, maintaining brand consistency and clarity, while ensuring traceability and KPI adherence.

**Qualifications:** 

● Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Marketing, or a related field.

● Proven graphic design experience, underscored by a strong portfolio that demonstrates both creativity and versatility.

● Mastery of industry-standard design tools, notably Adobe Creative Suite (including Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro and InDesign).

● Stellar writing skills with an aptitude for crafting clear, compelling copy that complements visual content.

● An unyielding attention to detail, ensuring all outputs are top-notch.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

title: MAT RN Manager
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

The RN Supervisor is a Registered Professional Nurse who has accountability for the management of patient care and input to actual decision making into all situations effecting the smooth operation of the facility. It is the responsibility of the Nurse Supervisor to provide leadership and act as a role model for all personnel. The Nurse Supervisor maintains the quality of patient care through an on-going process of assessment, planning, implementation and the supervision of nursing activities. The Nurse Supervisor works with other departments to provide coordinated services to the patients.

**The offered salary range is $90-110K annually.**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

· Supports and promotes the philosophy, objective, policies and procedures of Acacia’s Care Facility and the Nursing Department

· Keeps the Administrator on call, informed of facility problems that need concern

· Effectively leads, manages and directs the staff on the unit to provide quality patient care

· Provides communication between shifts to promote continuity of patient care

· Ensures staff accurately completes tour assigned Comprehensive Care Plans (CCP’s) by the completion target date

· Supervises and evaluates the patient’s comprehensive care plan, assuring that it is current at all times

· Provides leadership at Unit Conferences, Quality Improvement Program and Infection Control issues

· Participates in environmental rounds and maintains a safe environment for residents and employees

· Develops and monitors quality improvement indicators that are reflective of the unit population, identifying trends and pattern data and determines corrective action plans

· Is knowledgeable of and makes reference to available Policy Manuals

· Arranges for and/or participates in education of staff, residents and families; fosters and implements programs that support an environment for staff development; attends scheduled assigned meetings

· Monitors budget as assigned

· Interacts with patients’ families and significant others to promote resident well-being and resolve conflicts

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Bachelor of Science from an accredited institution
* Valid New York State Registered Nurse license
* One (3) years experience providing nursing services, preferable serving chemically dependent clients in residential settings or Methadone outpatient
* Two (2) years of management experience required
* Previous relevant experience in delivering nursing services
* Knowledge of regulatory body policies, procedures, and protocols
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Ability to use business acumen to exercise good judgment and decision-making
* Experience working with Microsoft Office
* Experience using Electronic Medical Records (EMR)
* Bilingual Spanish/English, preferred
* COVID-19 Vaccination Required

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

title: Boba Barista
description:
As a member of our team, we provide training and a friendly work environment. As we grow, we would like you to grow with us. There will be promotion opportunities to take on more responsibilities including being a store manager. The store has just recently opened and we are searching for friendly and accountable (boba) baristas who are interested in boba and seeking part-time work.

Pay starts at $16/hour PLUS TIPS

Boba Barista Responsibilities:

* Welcoming customers and answering any questions about the menu
* Taking orders
* Preparing drinks and making boba when need
* Selling prepackaged food
* Cleaning and restocking work and dining areas, emptying trash and sanitizing equipment and utensils throughout the shift as needed
* Taking inventory and replenishing items in display cases, at tables, or behind the counter
* Adhering to all food safety regulations and quality controls
* Attending training to learn about brewing methods, beverage preparation, and presentation techniques to improve quality
* Morning shifts: preparing ingredients for the day including brewing tea, cooking the first batch of boba, and preparing the other ingredients for drinks
* Evening shifts: completing end of day cleaning and store closing checklist

Boba Barista Requirements

* Customer service qualities: positive attitude, punctuality, and willingness to help out where needed
* Proficient listening and communication skills
* Ability to walk, bend, and stand for extended periods
* Availability to work around peak hours, including nights, early mornings, weekends, and holidays

Experience in food and beverage preparation and customer service is required.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 16 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift

Experience:

* Boba/Bubble Tea Shop/Cafe: 1 year (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)
* Night Shift (Preferred)

title: Service Technician
description:
**About Us**

THE FRANKLIN COMPANY CONTRACTORS, INC is a fourth-generation construction company specializing in the installation, maintenance and repair of petroleum fuel dispensing and storage systems. The company has three distinct divisions servicing the NYC metropolitan area for Construction, Service and Environmental Compliance of petroleum fuel systems. The Franklin Company's success over its 90 years in business has been driven by its core values of Honor, Efficiency and Value and unsurpassed knowledge of the pump and tank industry and regulations.

**Overview**  
This is a full-time on-site role as an Experienced Service Technician responsible for the maintenance and repair of petroleum fuel dispensing and storage systems in the New York City Metropolitan Area, Westchester County (NY), and Fairfield County (CT). The Service Technician will be responsible for troubleshooting, field service, and customer service.

**Responsibilities**  
- Perform maintenance and repairs on retail/commercial fueling equipment

- Troubleshoot and diagnose network, hydraulic, mechanical, electrical & electronic issues

- Conduct electrical testing and repairs

- Utilize mechanical knowledge to solve complex problems

- Maintain accurate records of service performed

- Collaborate with team members to ensure efficient operations

- Drive a commerical company service vehicle to work locations

- Maintain inventory on service vehicle

- Perform scheduled on-call work rotation

- Perform over-time work as needed

**Experience**  
- 2+ years as a petroleum technician

- Dispenser Repair Experience & Certifications

- UST/AST Troubleshooting

- Veeder-Root TLS certification

- Verifone Commander and/or Gilbarco Passport certification

Expected hours: 40 – 55 per week

* Paid time off

* Home daily

* Weekends as needed

title: Caregiver
description:
**Integrity Home Care**

We are seeking experienced caregivers to become a part of our team! We offer a supportive work environment as well as a flexible work schedule!

We host an open house every Wednesday from 10:00 am – 2:00 pm, no appointment is necessary!

Our office is at 153 Main Street, Suite 1. We are a single-standing white building wedged between Dunkin Donuts and Chase Bank. There is parking on Main Street, or you can park behind the Chase Bank.

If you cannot come on a Wednesday, feel free to make an appointment, call us at 631-406-7978, and we would be happy to schedule a time that works for you!

**On the job you must be able to:**

* Monitor and report changes in clients' health status
* Provide personal care such as bathing, dressing clients, meal preparation, light housekeeping, medication reminders, walking assistance, and recreational activities
* Take clients to their appointments, the grocery store, and other important places
* Maintain a safe and comfortable home environment

\\* Depending on the level of care needed, Caregivers may require specialized skills, such as:

* Ability to understand social, emotional and/or mental health concerns for patients
* Ability to provide Alzheimer’s or dementia care
* Ability to provide hospice care

**Job Requirements**

* Driver's license and social security card
* Work-related references
* Physical, Tuberculosis test, and drug test
* Positive and patient demeanor
* Ability to build rapport with clients
* Excellent communication skills

**Benefits**

* Full Time and Part Time hours available
* Weekly Pay
* Referral Bonus
* Paid time off
* Understanding and supportive office staff

title: Part Time Dental Assistant
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Dental Assistant to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have experience in providing exceptional patient care and supporting the dental team in a fast-paced environment. This role is ideal for individuals who are passionate about oral health and are committed to delivering high-quality care.

Duties:

- Assist dentists and hygienists during patient procedures, including vital sign monitoring, preparing treatment rooms, and maintaining infection control protocols.  
- Maintain accurate and organized patient records, ensuring compliance with HIPAA regulations.  
- Participate in dental procedures such as X-rays and pediatric dentistry.  
- Collaborate with the dental receptionist to manage patient flow and coordinate appointments.  
- Demonstrate a solid understanding of dental anatomy and be able to explain procedures to patients.  
- Maintain a clean and organized environment, adhering to all OSHA guidelines.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring patients feel comfortable and informed throughout their visit.

Requirements:  
- Familiarity with dental assisting techniques and procedures.  
- Strong knowledge of dental anatomy and terminology.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Certification in dental assisting or willingness to obtain certification within a specified timeframe.  
- Compliant with HIPAA regulations.  
- Experience with X-rays and other dental equipment.  
- Ability to maintain infection control protocols and ensure a clean environment.  
- High school diploma or equivalent required.  
- Proficiency with dental software Eaglesoft and electronic health records.

Skills:  
- Dental assisting  
- HIPAA  
- X-Ray  
- Pediatric dentistry  
- Anatomy knowledge  
- Infection control

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
**Overview**  
The Warehouse Manager is responsible for overseeing the overall operations of the warehouse at Western Specialty Contractors. This includes managing equipment, rental records, and material ordering, as well as coordinating deliveries to job sites. The Warehouse Manager plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth running of projects by facilitating the availability of necessary items. This individual will be in our Sealants department.  
**Responsibilities:**

*Customer Service*

* Maintain quality relationships with Western Branch personnel and outside customers.
* Provide assistance and information requested to customers.
* Provide economical and alterative options based on needs and availability
* Responsible for prompt resolution of customer related issues and related follow-up paperwork
* Quality control of processed orders to ensure accuracy in shipments

*Inventory* 

* Determine adequate levels of inventory items to ensure availability of product for orders and eliminate overstocking.
* Submit accurate and timely Purchase Orders to Vendor for stock orders as well as drop shipped orders.
* Solid understanding of principles and practices involved in managing a day-to-day warehouse operation.
* Investigate, report, and adjust inventory shortages and discrepancies.
* Confirm accuracy of all incoming orders
* Back up Service Manager, when necessary.

*Logistics and Transportation*

* Schedule transportation for both incoming and outgoing stock products
* Track and follow up on transit shipments
* Determine and maintain adequate stock of shipping materials

*Overall Warehouse*

* Pack and prepare orders for shipping
* Input Sales orders into Quickbooks for shipped products
* Maintain clean and organized warehouse conditions
* Maintain a safe work environment
* Daily opening/closing facility including arming/disarming alarm and locking exterior gate.
* Quickbooks experience a plus
* Experience in Microsoft Office
* General knowledge of construction materials and equipment
* Experience in shipping and receiving

**Qualifications**  
· 2+ years of distribution/retail experience

· Experience in Microsoft Office

· General knowledge of construction materials and equipment

· Experience in shipping and receiving

· Ability to lift and carry 50#’s

· Good communication and problem-solving skills

· Comfortable working in a warehouse setting (no air conditioning)

· General computer knowledge for inventory management program and shipping program

· Strong mechanical and problem-solving skills

· Ability to read schematics and blueprints

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $75,000.00 per year

title: Personable & Experienced Dental Assistant -Brooklyn
description:
Come join our growing Wellspring Dental team at our Carroll Gardens office (**located 2 blocks from Carroll Street stop F, G lines**) in Brooklyn.

We are looking to add an exceptional dental assistant for 5 days a week. **Monday and Saturday required, with the option to take Wednesday or Thursday off.**

We are looking for a *positive, professional, bright,* team player to help us provide top notch care to our incredible patients. Seeking an assistant with at least **4 years chair side experience in general dentistry or specialty practice.**

Duties to include, but not limited to: **chair side assisting**, setup/teardown of operatories, sterilization, digital X-rays and photos, charting, digital impressions with itero scanner.

**Must have at least 4 year dental experience in General Dentistry or Specialty Practice.**

**Pay: Commensurate with experience + benefits package to be discussed at interview.**

Experience with Curve dental software is a plus but not a dealbreaker!

Responsibilities

* Welcome customers in the dental office
* Prepare patients for treatments or checkups ensuring their comfort
* Select and set up instruments, equipment and material needed
* Sterilize instruments according to regulations
* Assist the dentist preferably through 4-handed dentistry
* Assist hygiene team with charting/breaking down rooms
* Undertake lab tasks as instructed
* Monthly inventory/ordering
* Provide oral hygiene and post-operative care instructions
* Keep the dental room clean and well-stocked
* Light clerical work such as insurance breakdowns/recare calls during downtime
* Occasionally cover at our other Manhattan/Brooklyn locations on the rare occasion that a team member is out sick. (**MUST BE A TEAM PLAYER**)

**Skills**

* Proven experience as dental assistant
* Knowledge of dental instruments and sterilization methods
* Understanding of health & safety regulations
* Ability to perform regulated non-surgical tasks like coronal polishing is a plus
* Good Mac computer skills
* Excellent communication and people skills
* Attention to detail
* Well-organized and reliable
* High school diploma; graduating from dental assistant school is preferred
* Additional certification or training is an asset (e.g. EFDA)

title: Training Coordinator (on site)
description:
Company Overview: Essen Health Care is a growing community healthcare network provides high quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a ‘population health’ model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering services in primary & specialty offices, urgent care centers, and nursing homes, as well as house calls for home bound patients; all clinical services are also offered via telehealth. Our Care Management division supports patient-centered care through care coordination, complex care management and helping address health-related social needs.

Founded in 1999, Essen provides care in all five boroughs of New York City, with a primary focus in the Bronx. Staffed by over 300 primary and specialty care physicians and advanced clinicians, Essen Health Care is one of the largest, most comprehensive private medical groups in New York City. Essen maintains a Clinical Information Services team that maintains our enterprise-wide electronic medical record system, data repository, clinical analytics and population health capabilities. Our Community Services teams creates and sustains relationship with community organizations and agencies and health plans.

Essen is dedicated to ensuring the quality of care for all patients and has been designated ‘Level 3 Patient Centered Medical Home’ by the National Committee for Quality Assurance. Essen has won awards for its patient care innovations and recently launched Intention Health Ventures to develop and commercialize our technology innovations.  
- Experience in facilitating classroom-based training sessions  
- Strong research skills to stay updated on industry trends  
- Familiarity with project management principles for coordinating training initiatives  
- Proficiency in using Learning Management Systems (LMS) for organizing and delivering training content  
- Previous experience in training development or instructional design is preferred

We offer competitive compensation packages including benefits such as health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

If you are passionate about employee development and have a strong background in training coordination, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team as a Training Coordinator!

**Position title:** Clinical Training Coordinator

**Job Summary:** The Clinical Trainer will support the Clinical Training Coordinator and be responsible for developing & facilitating training programs for New hires in collaboration with other Clinical trainers and Director of Training & Development. Assesses the needs of a business, implements training and development plans, and facilitates a wide variety of training programs that enhance the effectiveness of the Training division.

· Obtain knowledge of, and apply up-to-date Essen Health Care policies, protocols, and training workflows.

· Meet with Management to review training materials and processes.

· Research best practices and bring fresh ideas to the table.

· Work with Management to create and update handouts, manuals, visual aids, PowerPoint presentations, etc. to support training implementation.

· Investigate new applications and technologies to help automate processes.

· Work with Management to create a schedule and coordinate training for multiple training sessions.

· Organize and maintain training logistics, locations, and equipment.

· Deliver training via 1 on 1 group sessions

· Monitor staff during training sessions and deliver evaluations to Management regarding training needs.

· Work with Management to help track compliance and maintain logs, records, and results of training.

· Promote positive company culture: Building friendly working relationships amongst staff, welcoming new hires, and assisting in coordinating and participating in team-building activities.

· Any other duties as needed.

· Associates and/or bachelor’s degree

· Minimum 1-2 years Training experience

· Health Home experience a plus

· Health Care experience

· Knowledge of best teaching/training/compliance practices.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Strong teamwork skills.

· Good organizational and time management skills.

· Knowledge of Health Management and Social Service programs a plus.

· Experienced with Microsoft 365 Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.)

· Familiarity with online training tools (LMS) is a Training module Platform.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills (Public speaking).

· Excellent customer service skills required.

· Salary Range- $55,000-$58,000 annually

title: After-School Technology Instructor
description:
Are you a tech enthusiast looking for a fun and rewarding part-time opportunity to inspire change? Look no further than ScholarStem! We're seeking a dynamic instructor to lead one of our after-school technology courses for elementary or middle schoolers.

**Topics we teach:**

* AI Art
* Coding
* Drones
* Podcasting
* Web Design
* Game Design
* Robotics

**Job Features**

* **Competitive Pay:** Hourly rate ranges from $49-$60, depending on experience and location.
* **Flexible Scheduling:** You have freedom in choosing your site, depending on its hours and location. We never place you without your input.
* **Growth & Impact**: Develop valuable skills and make a meaningful difference in the lives of hundreds of students daily. You also get rewarded for staying on the team through consistent pay increases and bonuses.
* **Diverse Opportunities**: Beyond teaching, engage in paid roles like curriculum design, contributing to company innovation, substitution roles, and earning through referrals.

**Hours and Location**

* **Multiple Locations**: Choose from multiple sites across the New York City metro area.
* **Convenient Timing**: After-school classes primarily run from 2:30 PM to 5:30 PM, typically meeting once or twice weekly, aligning well with various schedules. We also have opportunities during the school day!

**Instructor Requirements**

**1. Devotion to Education**: Seeking individuals with a genuine passion for teaching K-8 students. Your patience and skill in managing classrooms equipped with computers are essential. We maintain a favorable instructor-to-student ratio of 12:1 to ensure an effective learning environment.  
**2. Tech-Savvy and Eager to Learn**: While coding knowledge is a plus, it's not a prerequisite. We value your experience with technology and your enthusiasm for learning new, user-friendly programming languages. Your willingness to embrace tech advancements will be key.  
**3. Commitment to Punctuality**: Reliability is paramount. We expect all instructors to uphold a standard of absolute punctuality, as this is critical for the smooth operation of our classes and respect for student time.

**How to Apply**

If you’re interested in helping us provide tech education for future innovators, apply with your resume. We look forward to seeing you on the ScholarStem team!

**About us**

Join a team that's been making a difference in K-8 education since 2015. ScholarStem is a leading provider of after-school tech programs, and we're looking for passionate instructors who share our mission of delivering engaging, project-based tech curriculum. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to grow in your role and beyond, and we treat everyone as peers. Come join us and make an impact on the next generation of tech innovators!

title: Property Manager
description:
CIS Management, Inc. an Award Winning Property Management Company provides comprehensive and responsive property management services. Recognized as one of New Jersey’s premier affordable and creative housing solutions provider, CIS Management is committed to a hands-on, around-the-clock approach. **We are currently looking for a Property Manager at our Lawrenceville, NJ Location!**

**The Property Manager is responsible for planning, controlling, and directing the day to day operation and for maintaining effective and harmonious resident relations. The Property Manager will work to meet the financial objectives of the ownership and management, protect the value and integrity of the property, and to be responsive to all applicable government agency standards and requirements.**

**RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:**

* Prepare and present the property's annual budget for approval to senior management, and the implementation of and adherence to the approved budget and occupancy goals
* Prepare and submit the monthly budget variance report
* Responsible for the accurate and timely establishment of rent amounts as approved by senior management, the timely collection and deposit of all rental and other payments due from residents, and the taking of corrective and/or legal action as required to obtain collection.
* Coordinate the preparation and submission of the monthly rental vouchers to HUD
* Review of the properties’ re-certification process for completeness, accuracy, and timeliness, and maintains accurate records in compliance with all governing agencies.
* Ensure properties are maintained according to company policy and are as safe and secure as possible.
* Implement all maintenance policies, plans, and procedures, such as work order systems, purchase order systems, preventive maintenance system, inventory control, and turnover process.
* Approves all rental applications, insuring strict compliance to property and government agency and program standards.
* Performs personnel training, conducts annual performance reviews, and recommends salary adjustments.
* Responsible for compliance with Affirmative Fair Housing regulations and Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action policies, including federal, state, and local governing agency requirements

**Requirements:**

* Must have 2 - 3 years' experience in Tax-Credit, Section 8 and Affordable Housing - ***HIGHLY PREFERRED***
* Must have experience as a leasing professional in a residential community with a proven track record of success in meeting occupancy and delinquency.
* Annual certification experience.
* Supervisory experience of personnel and maintenance staff.
* Must have great customer service and able to handle and resolve resident conflicts.
* Experience with property management software, YARDI a strong plus.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Word, Excel and Outlook.

**Schedule:**

***Must be able to work between the appropriate business hours.***

Monday - Friday 9:00AM - 5:00PM (40 hours per week) - In-person role

**Benefits/Perks:**

* Medical, prescription & dental benefits available for both employee & families

* Paid time off, based on years of service

title: Mystery Room Associate
description:
**MYSTERY ROOM ASSOCIATE**  
When people ask us what we do as a company, we simply reply by saying "we connect people through shared, interactive fun".

**WHEN YOU BECOME ONE OF OUR ASSOCIATES, YOU:**

* Display Outstanding Customer Care
* Show Great Attention to Detail
* Communicate Effectively
* Help Drive/Achieve the 3 Rs ( **R\\*evenue,** R**ewards & Online** R\\*eviews)
* Demonstrate the Utmost Level of Professionalism
* Collaborate With Your Fellow Teammates
* Instill Trust/Show High Integrity
* Possess A Positive “All In” Attitude

**We're looking for an energetic, service-oriented individual to join our team as a Mystery Room Associate!**

All in Adventures was launched in 2014 with a simple mission: to connect families, friends, coworkers, students, and a host of others together through shared fun in a socially interactive environment. Visiting guests get the chance to either become real-life mystery detectives, game show contestants, axe throwers, or interactive room champions. Today, the brand has grown to roughly 30 locations offering a wide variety of family-focused, experiential game activities. In 2018 we were voted World's Best Escape Room and have even been featured on an episode of the Real Housewives of Atlanta.

We're on a mission . . . to become the leader in providing an interactive and engaging entertainment experience through exceptional guest service, game experience and value and we can’t do that without great Associates who have a true passion for making customers happy.

We are currently looking for a goal-oriented, enthusiastic part-time **MYSTERY ROOM ASSOCIATE** to join our super engaged, guest-centric team of  
Associates. This isn’t your typical “retail” role. As a Mystery Room Associate with AIA, your primary goal is “to facilitate fun” by constantly interacting with, and servicing visiting players as they arrive for their reserved game times! This is a great opportunity for anyone excited for the chance to grow and develop with a company that is looking to change the face of how people interact socially through live games and activities. If you are looking for a new role with tons of variety . . . **this is the job for you:**

**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR IN OUR MYSTERY ROOM ASSOCIATES:**

* Represent the All In Adventures brand in a friendly and professional manner during every customer/employee interaction
* Exhibit polite, respectful behavior as guests enter, experience and exit the venue
* Go above and beyond to meet their needs – actively looking for ways to wow our visiting guests
* Achieve team and individual goals by promoting and selling all AIA game services and VIP Reward offers
* Enthusiastically greet new guests as they arrive for their scheduled appointments, or simply stop in to inquire about the experience
* Use excellent verbal skills as you provide information to guests about the overall game experience, room options, and safety rules
* Exhibit good manners as you guide each guest to their selected game room
* Even if they beg, don’t give away clues – simply help our guests get moving again by providing a (teeny-tiny) hint
* Be there to support, encourage, and affirm their game strategy as they exit their rooms – plus invite them back in the future after you take a keepsake photo using our greenscreen technology
* Be an active contributor to daily housekeeping operations – including the quick, sanitizing, and accurate recovery of each game room immediately after use
* Have an open ear to any guest who happens to express any dissatisfaction with their experience, escalating their grievances upward with urgency
* Arrange furniture, backdrops, props, or window displays, as outlined by company standards
* Ensure signage, written game clues, etc., reflect appropriate changes in themed promotions and uphold company guidelines
* Perform daily opening/end-of-day tasks

**REQUIREMENTS FOR CONSIDERATION** . . . (DON’T **OVERLOOK** THESE IMPORTANT CLUES)

§ High School Diploma (or GED).

§ 1 year of previous customer service experience.

§ Be 18 years of age or older.

§ Able to lift up to 50lbs.

§ Must successfully pass 2 – 3 professional reference checks.

§ Able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

§ Multi-tasking capability and good time management skills.

§ Able to adapt to during slow/fast-paced reservation days with group sizes of 50 or more.

**JOIN OUR TEAM AND YOU’LL ENJOY:**

* **A Fun/Casual, Family-Friendly Workplace**
* **Collaborative, Engaged Co-Workers/Managers**
* **Paid Training + A 90-Day On-the-Job Training Program**
* **Work-Life Balance!**  *(Mystery Associates typically work varied 4 – 5 hour shifts between the hours of 10am – 9pm)*
* **Career Advancement**
* **A Competitive Base Wage + A Potential Pay Increase After Just 90 Days + Paid Quarterly Bonus + Other Fun Incentives!**
* **A Company That Encourages “Being Yourself”** (we love self-proclaimed game nerds, and quirky, humorous, theatrical individuals!)

*All in Adventures, LLC. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. All in Adventures recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.*

**APPLY NOW** . . . ( **RACE THE CLOCK!** YOU DON’T WANT TO GET LEFT OUT OF THIS OPPORTUNITY):

**Email a copy of your resume for immediate consideration.**

title: Dietitian
description:
**Dietitian – County of Bergen**

**Department of Human Services - Division of Senior Services**

Registered dietician plans diets and develops and implements dietary plans based on nutritional assessment and the special nutritional needs of individuals; does related work as required.

**Job Responsibilities: (may include but not limited to)**

· Monitor and evaluate food safety in the preparation, packaging, and delivery of congregate and home delivered meals.

· Monitor (periodically) home delivery routes for acceptability of temperature, quality and food safety of home delivered meals as received by the client.

· Plans diets and supervises the preparation and serving of regular and therapeutic diets to individuals prescribed by medical staff in order to meet the nutritional needs of such individuals.

· Develop and/or identify nutrition education materials and presentations relative to the needs of older adults (for use with homebound and congregate meal provision). Coordinate and approve nutrition education programs for congregate nutrition sites.

· Conduct, and/or coordinate nutrition education programs for participants at each nutrition program site and distribute literature to homebound participants, at least quarterly.

· Congregate Nutrition Programs (county and municipal) operate between 8:30-3:00 pm Monday – Friday. Must be available for nutrition education programs during these hours of operation.

· Conduct and/or coordinate and evaluate in-service training for nutrition staff and volunteers annually.

· Identify and coordinate nutrition education materials to be distributed to homebound participants monthly (minimum of quarterly).

· Provide Nutritional Counseling in-home, Zoom or telephone for frail, elderly seniors who need counseling services, on a priority basis to enhance and improve nutritional well-being. Also provide counseling services to individuals with a disability 18 years of age and older (or caregivers on behalf of participants) to enhance and improve health and nutritional status. Maintain a record of completed services.

· Compile Federal and State data collection requirements and generate reports for monthly, quarterly and annual nutrition reports.

· Coordinate and evaluate annual Nutrition Screenings of HDM and congregate participants.

· Represent the Division of Senior Services Nutrition Program and participate in community wellness events and health fairs.

· Maintain ServSafe or National Registry of Food Safety Professionals Food Manager Certification. Must have knowledge, experience and certification of safe food handling policies and procedures to provide in-service training for center staff and volunteers.

· Perform all related tasks to ensure efficient operation of programs under the DSS Nutrition and Wellness unit including congregate, and home delivered meal programs.

**Schedule:** 

· Per-Diem / Monday – Friday

**Education & Licensing Requirements:** 

· Three (3) years of recent, relevant experience working with older adults in a food and nutrition related capacity. (possession of a Master’s Degree in Foods and Nutrition, or Institutional Management *(may be substituted for 1 year of work experience).*

· Registered Dietitian Nutritionist and possess current registration with the Commission on Dietetic Registration.

**Other Requirements:**

· Strong verbal and written communication skills.

· Computer literacy (MS Excel and Word).

· Valid New Jersey Driver’s License.

Please send employment application to resume@co.bergen.nj.us – ***put in subject line job applying for, thank you.***

The County of Bergen is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.

*It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of The County of Bergen not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, caregiver status, unemployment status or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state and/or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination.*

title: Case Planner (bi-lingual)
description:
**Bilingual Case Planner** [I'RAISE + ACS]

**Title**: Case Planner

**Classification**: Non-Exempt

**Status**: Full-time

**Salary**: $61,000

**Location:** Any borough in New York City [must be able to commute]

**Supervisor**: Case Planner Supervisor

**Hire Date:** Hiring immediately

***Job Requirement:*** *Must be bilingual in Spanish speaking, have experience working in the Human Service/Social Service Field; 7+ years of program director experience; 5+ years of supervision experience.* 

**I’RAISE + ACS:** 

I’RAISE is partnering with the Administration for Children’s Services (ACS) using the School-Based-Early Support model. The goal is to partner closely with schools to connect families to support and services well before concerns warrant a call to the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment (SCR). ACS, through I’RAISE, intends to offer families “light touch” service options that strive to connect families to community resources through case management, address families’ concrete needs, support parent/caregiver capacity in their caregiving roles, and avoid unnecessary investigations.

**Position Summary**:

The **Full-time Case Planner (MSW)** will be responsible for providing comprehensive case management services to families enrolled in the School-Based Early Support program. They will work closely with families, school staff, and community partners to assess needs, develop service plans, coordinate access to resources, and monitor progress towards goals. The Case Planner (MSW) will utilize trauma-informed practices, motivational interviewing techniques, and evidence-based interventions to support families in achieving positive outcomes.

The case planner will handle ACS-Mandated cases and non-ACS Mandated Case (under I'RAISE IMW Model - i.e., 1:1 and group sessions, counseling, SEL, workshops, etc.).

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for providing prevention services to caseloads of no more than 12 families in assigned school site
* Responsible for providing individual and group sessions to caseloads of no more than 30 to 40 students per school [Usually total of 2 assigned school sites]
* Conduct comprehensive assessments of family strengths, needs, and goals
* Develop individualized service plans in collaboration with families, incorporating their input and preferences
* Provide ongoing case management support, including crisis intervention, advocacy, and referral to community resources
* Coordinate with school staff, community partners, and other service providers to ensure seamless delivery of services
* Monitor progress towards goals and adjust service plans as needed
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date case records in accordance with agency policies and regulatory requirements
* Participate in team meetings, case conferences, and trainings as required
* Provide support and guidance to less experienced staff as needed
* Collaborate with program leadership to evaluate program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement
* Case Planners to student ratio will be 1:10 - Caseloads may be manageable to ensure case planners can effectively deliver quality case management; to ensure clients receive support and professional development, and for families to receive quality services

**Qualifications / Requirements**:

* Must be bilingual Spanish speaking
* Masters in Social Work (MSW) degree or relevant human service field, highly preferred
* At least two years of relevant social work and case planning experience; providing case management services to children and families, preferably in a school-based or community-based setting
* Knowledge of child welfare and family support services in New York City required
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
* Proficiency in Google Suite and case management software preferred

**Travel Requirement**:

* Ability to travel within New York City public schools to perform job-based duties
* Must be a New York City Resident with a valid Social Security Number - *I’RAISE does not provide relocation assistance nor provide any visa sponsorship at this time*

**Full-Time Employee Benefits**:

* Paid-time off (PTO):
* Vacation: 10 days for 1st & 2nd year, 14 days for 3rd year, 20 days for 4th year and onward, 6 days personal, 6 days sick, holidays, etc. Mental health days (1 day per month)
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits
* Retirement Plan - Matching
* Worker Compensation
* Disability Benefit
* Professional Development Small Tuition Reimbursement
* Loan Forgiveness - We are a qualified employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. To read about eligibility requirements visit https://studentaid.gov/manage-loans/forgiveness-cancellation/public-service
* Any added employee benefit

**Must complete background check requirements:** 

* Reference Checking
* DOE Fingerprint clearance
* SCR Clearance - OCFS
* SEL List Check - OCFS

**TO APPLY & FOR MORE INFORMATION**

**Visit** 

**Complete the Job Application Form** 

***About IRAISE***

*I'RAISE Girls & Boys International Corporation is a heartfelt haven founded in 2012 by the visionary Chief Executive Officer, Shanequa Moore. As a beacon of hope and resilience, we stand tall as a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, proudly led by individuals from BIPOC and women communities. Since our inception, we have woven a tapestry of support, dedication, and transformation that defines who we are.*

*I’RAISE is not just an organization; it is a promise to make a difference in the lives of families. We are the guardians of youth, catalysts for community restoration, and architects of improved quality of life for minority children and families. Our purpose is etched in the very fabric of our holistic programs that commit to the well-being and empowerment of every child.*

*RAISE, EMPOWER, AND INSPIRE EVERY CHILD is not just a mantra; it's our guiding vision since 2012. We aspire to elevate self-esteem and self-worth, ensuring that every child, irrespective of background, finds success and progress in all facets of life*

*Join us in this journey of compassion, empowerment, and transformation. Together, we can rewrite the narrative for every child, building a future where potential knows no bounds.*

Job Type: Full-time

title: Registered Dietitian (Part-time)
description:
***Join Our Team of Registered Dietitians Part Time at NutraCo!***

Are you a compassionate and driven Registered Dietitian seeking a rewarding career in clinical nutrition?

NutraCo, a leading provider of Clinical Nutrition Services to Long Term Care facilities across the United States, has an exciting opportunity for you!

We are currently seeking a motivated individual to join us as an Onsite Registered Dietitian, located near Allendale, NJ. This is a part-time position offering a competitive hourly rate for the right motivated individual.

***Please apply to find out more!***

***Why Choose NutraCo?***

At NutraCo, we pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care with respect and dignity to residents in Long Term Care facilities nationwide. When you join our team, you become part of a supportive environment where your contributions are valued and acknowledged.

*Here are just a few reasons to consider a career with NutraCo:*

* **Room for Growth:** We offer development opportunities and upward mobility within the company, empowering you to advance your career.
* **Collaborative Environment:** Join a network of dedicated dietitians who support and interact with each other, fostering a sense of community and teamwork.
* **Valued Professionalism:** Your work as a professional is highly valued and acknowledged at NutraCo, where your voice is heard, and feedback is encouraged and supported.
* **Clear Expectations**: We provide clear goals, directives, and feedback, ensuring you have the resources and support needed to excel in your role.
* **Opportunity for Relocation:** With multiple locations throughout the United States, NutraCo offers the flexibility to relocate if needed, allowing you to grow with us wherever life takes you.

***Responsibilities:***

As a Registered Dietitian at NutraCo, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of our residents by addressing nutrition-related health problems through clinical nutrition treatment.

*Your responsibilities will include:*

* Providing compassionate care and support to residents, focusing on their nutritional needs and well-being.
* Collaborating with other dietitians and facility clinical team to deliver personalized nutrition plans and ensure the highest level of care.
* Completing necessary clinical assessments, charting within the EMR system, and attending meetings to discuss resident care and progress.
* Conducting meal rounds if/as needed, completing sanitation audits, and signing off on dietary menus to maintain quality standards.

***Requirements:***

*To succeed in this role, you must meet the following requirements:*

* Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) or Registration Eligible with a Verification Statement
* State licensure guidelines must be met, along with facility vaccination as required.
* Strong communication skills, effective teamwork, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated environment.

***Salary and Benefits Offered Include:***

* Competitive rates starting at $30/hr. DOE
* Comprehensive Benefits Package Options Include:
* Company Managed 401(k) Program
* Continuing Education Credits
* Life and Disability Insurance Options
* Employee Discounts as Applicable

*Are you a dedicated Registered Dietitian looking to join a supportive team and make a difference in the lives of residents?* ***We want to hear from you!***

***Apply now*** *to join NutraCo and embark on a rewarding career journey in clinical nutrition!*

title: Administrative ASL Interpreter for the Superintendent
description:
**Scope of Work:**

Mill Neck Manor School for the Deaf seeks a dedicated and proficient American Sign Language

(ASL) Interpreter to support our Superintendent and the school. This position requires a skilled

ASL interpreter to facilitate effective communication for the Superintendent in various settings,

such as meetings, presentations, Board meetings, and conferences. During non-interpreting

sessions, the interpreter will perform tasks such as social media, newsletters, and developing

the annual report for the community.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

**ASL Interpreter:**

● Interpretation Services:

○ Provide accurate and efficient interpretation from ASL to English and vice versa

during meetings, presentations, phone calls, Board meetings, and other

interactions involving the Superintendent.

○ Provides assistance in interpreting needs for the school when available, such as

IEPs, Parent Conferences, and facilitates communication for staff members.

○ Ensure clarity and comprehension in all interpreted communications.

**Confidentiality:**

○ Maintain strict confidentiality of all interpreted communications and adhere to the

ethical standards and guidelines set by the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

(RID).

Approved 6.18.24 - Superintendent - Mill Neck Manor School for the Deaf 1

● Will perform other duties as assigned by the Superintendent.

**Qualifications:**

● Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Deaf Studies, Interpreting) preferred.

● Certification by the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (RID) or equivalent certification.

● Minimum of 3 years of professional ASL interpreting experience, preferably in an

educational or administrative setting.

● Excellent command of American Sign Language and English.

● Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

● Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

● High level of professionalism, integrity, and confidentiality.

**Working Conditions:**

● Full-time position based at Mill Neck Manor School for the Deaf.

● Some after-hours and weekend work may be required for community events and

meetings.

● Travel with the Superintendent to various events as needed.

title: & Other Stories Retail Sales Ambassador
description:
**Company Description**  

Founded in 2010 by a small group of creatives**, & Other Stories** grew from the wish to give women the freedom of expression through one brand. We’re a one-stop styling destination filled with collections from our design ateliers in Stockholm and Paris.

 **Job Description**  

We believe that you will be a part of cultivating a friendly and warm shopping experience for & Other Stories customers through organic customer service, product knowledge, operational routines and overall upkeeping within a value driven team environment to drive sales.


Customer Service

* Greet and engage all customers in conversation
* Utilize an organic customer service approach to create an easy and inspiring shopping experience for every customer
* Provide relevant and detailed product knowledge of all & Other Stories merchandise including but not limited to fabric types, washing instructions, garment fits, trends etc.
* Communicates with customers courteously and promptly in-person and via phone


Operations

* Ability to complete the full garment processing cycle from unpacking to steaming per & Other Stories guidelines and best practices to maximize selling opportunities
* Handles customer transactions at the register and packages purchases according to & Other Stories standards in a courteous and friendly manner
* Replenishes all departments consistently throughout the day to ensure full inventory on the shop floor
* Upkeeps & Other Stories logistic standards and overall cleanliness of stockrooms and back stocked merchandise
* Maintains & Other Stories shop floor standards by ensuring product care is met throughout the day
* Supports with execution of reductions and campaign set ups according to & Other Stories guidelines
* Adheres to & Other Stories values, policies and procedures as outlined in company handbook

  

Team Player

* Partners with team members to ensure customers receive the best customer service in a friendly shopping environment
* Responsible for keeping shop floor and stockrooms clean, well maintained and handed over per & Other Stories standards
* Willingness and ability to readily respond to changing circumstances and expectations
* Assists in training new team members with high level of customer service focus
* Being straight forward and open minded including when receiving and sharing feedback

  

Financial Accountability: None

 **Qualifications**  

Minimum Candidate Qualifications:

* Must be able to work a flexible work schedule including nights and weekends
* High School graduate or equivalent preferred
* At least 6 months of experience in direct customer service, retail industry preferred
* Ability to lift in excess of 20 pounds
* Ability to stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance
* Ability to climb a ladder and use a step stool

  

Competencies:

* Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills
* Ability to recognize and execute selling opportunities
* Ability and willingness to run a cash register
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Lively interest and knowledge in fashion and design trends
* Passion and drive for retail industry
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to take initiative to complete tasks and solve problems
* Ability to meet deadlines
* Ability to manage time and prioritize

  

Job Status: Non-Exempt, Hourly (Part-Time or Full-Time)


The hourly pay for this role is $17.50

  

EEOC Classification: SLS

 **Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Program Supervsior 127
description:
Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen (CCDOM), with more than 450 employees is a non-profit, social services agency with its mission, driven by Catholic social teaching, of providing quality services with dignity and respect to the poor, vulnerable and all people in need and partnering with families and communities to improve the quality of life. We serve more than 68,000 clients per year throughout Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon, and Warren counties in NJ.

**Program Supervisor –** East Brunswick, NJ

· Annual Salary = $67,500

The Exchange Parent Aide Program is an evidence-supported service model forming part of a comprehensive, statewide family support services continuum that will provide supportive and educational in-home services for parents/caregivers. EPA will provide parents/caregivers with individualized family support, effective parenting skills and strategies, and teach them about enhanced social connections, social-emotional competency, child safety, and child development.

The Program Supervisor will lead a team (Parent Aides and Case Manager), as well as play an important role in supporting and delivering direct services to families in need within the Exchange Parent Aide Program (EPA).

***Responsibilities:***

· Team oversight of Parent Aides positions and Care Manager to ensure seamless EPA program operations.

· Provide reflective supervision to support the professional development and well-being of Parent Aides and Care Manager.

· Provide specialized support to employees with lived experience along with cultivating a supportive and inclusive work environment for the agency.

· contribute to the success and impact of the EPA in-home parenting support initiatives by leveraging their expertise in program management and dedication to supporting families and team members alike

***Requirements:***

· Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology, Social Work or equivalent experience with the child welfare system is required.

· Minimum of three years of case management, home visiting experience, mental health experience or work with at-risk families.

· Evening and weekend work may be necessary to meet the needs of the families; ability to manage supervision to numerous staff simultaneously; understanding of family dynamics, child development and social services delivery; effective oral and written communication skills.

· Valid drivers license in good standing.

***Benefits:***

CCDOM offers a competitive benefits plan that includes:

· Medical and Prescription

· Dental

· Vision

· Up to 13 Paid Holidays

· Begin with 20 Days of Paid Time Off

· Non-Contributory Pension Plan

· Ability to contribute to 403(b) retirement plan

· Life and Disability Insurance

***Agency Perks and Discounts:***

· Employee Assistance Program

· Verizon FIOS

· Affinity Federal Credit Union membership

· NJM Insurance

· Blue Cross Blue Shield

· Flex Spending Accounts

***Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,500.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

* Experience managing a grooming salon is a bonus!
* Exceptional client service with an easygoing and friendly interpersonal style
* High degree of independent decision-making and problem-solving capability
* Strong attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills

title: Executive Assistant to the Superintendent
description:
**Scope of Work:**

The Executive Administrative Assistant to the Superintendent provides high-level administrative

support, ensuring smooth operations within the Superintendent's office. This role requires

exceptional organizational skills, the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion, and a

strong commitment to supporting the mission of Mill Neck Manor School for the Deaf. The

Executive Administrative Assistant will play a pivotal role in managing the Superintendent's

schedule, coordinating meetings, handling communications, and assisting with special projects.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

**Administrative Support:**

● Manage the Superintendent's calendar, including scheduling appointments, meetings,

and travel arrangements.

● Prepare, review, and distribute correspondence, reports, and presentations on behalf of

the Superintendent.

● Organize and maintain confidential files and records.

● Serve as the primary point of contact between the Superintendent and internal/external

stakeholders.

● Coordinate and assist with Board of Trustees meetings, including preparation of

agendas, minutes, and follow-up actions.

**Communication Management:**

● Handle incoming calls, emails, and other communications directed to the Superintendent, responding on their behalf when appropriate.

● Draft and proofread letters, emails, and other documents.

● Facilitate communication between the Superintendent’s office and other departments

within the school.

● Ensure clear and effective communication across all levels of the organization.

Event and Meeting Coordination:

● Plan and coordinate special events, meetings, and conferences, including logistical

arrangements.

● Prepare meeting materials, agendas, and presentations, and ensure timely distribution.

● Take minutes during meetings, and track and follow up on action items.

● Assist in coordinating school events, including commencements, faculty meetings, and

other key functions.

● Support staff with scheduling of field trips.

**Project Management:**

● Assist in the development and execution of special projects and initiatives led by the

Superintendent.

● Research and compile data for reports and presentations.

● Monitor project timelines and deliverables, ensuring milestones are met.

● Liaise with other departments to facilitate project completion.

● Absent staff reporting, managing PTO in timekeeping system.

● Management of school vehicles.

● Coordinating internships and student teachers.

● Integrated/Community Student Program.

● Organizing after school transportation.

● Manage report card distribution.

● Back to school night oversight.

**Office Management:**

● Maintain office supplies and equipment for the Superintendent’s office.

● Ensure the office environment is organized and conducive to productivity.

● Provide backup support for other administrative functions as needed.

Confidentiality and Discretion:

● Handle sensitive and confidential information with the highest level of discretion.

● Ensure compliance with all school policies, procedures, and regulations.

**Additional Duties:**

● Assist with organizing school events and activities as needed.

● Provide support for special projects and initiatives as assigned.

● Performs other assigned tasks or duties as directed by the Superintendent

**Qualifications:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty

satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to perform each essential with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Education:**

● Bachelor’s degree preferred, or equivalent work experience in a related field.

● Strong written and verbal communication skills.

● Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.

● Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

● Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

**Language Skills:**

description:

Are you someone who embraces challenges, is eager to learn new skills, and is willing to go the extra mile to get the job done? If so, we want to hear from you! We have 2 positions open, so bring a qualified friend

Position: Maintenance Specialist

Specialization: Excavation, Carpentry, Lawn Care, and a Passion for Continuous Learning

Why Choose Us?

* Diverse Responsibilities: From excavation projects to crafting beautiful lawns, every day is a new adventure.
* Skill Development: Opportunities to expand your skill set and contribute to a well-rounded maintenance team.
* Flexible Schedule: Work hours that adapt to the seasonal demands of the job.

Responsibilities:

* Execute excavation and carpentry tasks with precision and efficiency.
* Showcase a green thumb by maintaining lawns to the highest standards.

19. Abides by the Midland Mission Statement in promoting ethical behavior, establishing relationships and providing guidance in decision-making situations.

20. Remains current with required training certifications, meets New Jersey-regulated licensing and regulatory accreditations, and adheres to mandatory requirements.

21. Maintains effective verbal and written communications with colleagues, those served, and their family members and/or guardians when applicable.

22. Reports unusual incidents and completes internal incident reports as needed according to MAS procedures.

23. Willingly and effectively cooperates with Midland, The Department of Human Services, The Office of Licensing, and any other licensing or state agency or local municipalities in any inspections and investigations, upon request.

title: Package Handler - Part Time (Warehouse like)
description:
**IMMEDIATE OPENINGS!**


Come for a job and stay for a career! Federal Express Corporation (FEC) is part of the rapidly growing warehouse and transportation sector that helps keep America, and our economy, moving. Be part of a winning team and workplace community that cares about who you are as an individual, and your safety in the workplace.

 **Perks and Benefits at Federal Express Corporation (FEC):**

* Competitive wages beginning at ﻿$18.00 per hour﻿ paid weekly for both full and part time opportunities
* $5,250 tuition reimbursement every year with no lifetime cap! All employees are eligible for this awesome benefit on their first day of employment!
* Generous paid time off program – work your way up to 5 weeks of PTO a year!
* Medical, dental and vision benefits after a short waiting period.
* Flexible scheduling that helps balance your work and personal life.
* Valuable employee discounts on things like cell phone plans, electronics, cars and restaurants.
* Free Purple Pathways career development program for all Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees.
* Paid parental leave for both moms and dads!
* Employee networks, and diversity, equity and inclusion programs available for all employees.

 **What you can expect at Federal Express Corporation (FEC):**

* Fast paced and physical warehouse work – why pay for a gym membership when you can get paid while working out?
* Warehouse duties include loading, unloading, and sorting of packages of various sizes.
* Part time Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees work one shift a day; full time Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees work two shifts.
* Shift lengths vary based on package volume – generally part time employees work between 3 and 6 hours a day. Full time employees can expect to work between 6 and 10 hours.
* Overtime paid after 40 hours a week.

 **Pay Transparency**


This compensation range is provided as a reasonable estimate of the current starting salary range for this role across all potential locations. If this opportunity includes multiple job levels, the salary information represents the job level minimum and the job level maximum. Actual starting pay would be determined by experience relative to the job, market level, pay at the location for this job and other job-related factors permitted by law. An employee may be eligible for additional pay, premiums, or bonus potential. The Company offers eligible employees health, vision and dental insurance, retirement, and tuition reimbursement.

 **Pay Range:** ﻿$19.00﻿

 **Additional Posting Information:** ﻿Early Morning Shifts Available Immediately; Must be available to work Monday thru Friday 3am-8am﻿  



  

**EEO Statement**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Reasonable accommodations are available for qualified individuals with disabilities throughout the application process. Applicants who require reasonable accommodations in the application or hiring process should contact recruitmentsupport@fedex.com.


Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws:

* Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law
* EEO is the Law Supplement
* Pay Transparency Policy
* Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
* Employee Polygraph Protection Act

  

E-Verify Program Participant: Federal Express Corporation participates in the Department of Homeland Security U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services' E-Verify program (For U.S. applicants and employees only). Please click below to learn more about the E-Verify program:

* E-Verify Notice (bilingual)
* Right to Work Notice (English) / (Spanish)

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**About Us:**  

Want to bring the “care” back to the vision care industry? We're looking for charismatic types who are ready to be the heart of our brand. Whether it's a friendly voice over the phone, or a welcoming smile when a patient walks into your store, we need individuals who are passionate about helping customers look great and see great.
  
  

**Pay Class:** Part Time
  
**Pay:** $16.50 - $22.69 per hour
  
  

**The Role:**  

A Visionworks Optical Specialist is the very face of our business and is dedicated to ensuring the best possible journey for every patient and customer. This person is trained and knowledgeable about optics, our products/services and managed vision care. The Sr. OS personally takes the patient/customer through the Visionworks experience ensuring their eyewear needs are met in a simple, human and bold way.
  
* Delivers daily sales goals by ensuring the best execution of the Customer/Patient Experience journey
* Engage with patients/customers and recommend products and services that meet their eye care needs
* Measure patients/customers for their eyewear and maintain product/optical knowledge through cont. training and development to ensure eyewear is Right the First Time
* Execute day-to-day operational activities to support the store's financial and customer experience goals including restocking inventory, merchandising, and order fulfillment of eyewear to ship


**Qualifications:**  

* 1 Related customer or patient experience preferred, but not necessary

title: Field Marketing & Brand Activation Coordinator (NYC)
description:
**Job Title:**

Field Marketing & Brand Activation Coordinator

**FLSA Classification:**

Exempt

**Department:**

Field Marketing

**Reports To:**

Regional Sales Manager

Job Summary:

The Field Marketing & Brand Activation Coordinator is responsible for the field marketing and brand activation support of Ayrloom brands. The position is a support role to both the sales and marketing teams. The territories will be assigned by the Sales Director & President.

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:** (Additional duties may be assigned)

1. Work with management to maintain existing accounts and to establish new opportunities for additional accounts.

2. Sample new prospective accounts.

3. Actively participate in weekly sales con-calls.

4. Establish, help to market and execute events to include festivals, concerts, the NYS Fair and similar events.

5. Work with the Brand Development team to help create and support POS marketing and promotional materials and assist with public relations.

6. Educate the buyer, distributor and customer on all things Ayrloom.

7. Train retailers on all aspects of Ayrloom products.

8. Work with marketing department to develop effective marketing programs.

9. Develop content for social media when in the field.

10. Assist marketing department with on-site sales meetings and tours.

11. Host retailers on Ayrloom properties.

12. Coordinate POS orders with Ayrloom Marketing team as needed.

13. Manage and arrange staffing as needed for events.

14. Track and report sales & depletions that occurred during retail driven consumer events.

15. Report back to wholesale team on consumer questions and habits during in store events.

16. Ensure all marketing materials are stocked in stores, display packaging is provided to all retailer partners, and POS displays are stocked, organized, and professionally presented.

**Minimum Qualification Standards:**

● Two-year associate degree required.

● Previous experience in Cannabis or alcoholic beverage market.

● Proficient in Microsoft Office including MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

● Gmail proficiency required.

● Valid driver’s license required.

● Equivalent combinations of education and work experience will be considered.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

● Strong written and oral communication skills to interact with co-workers and vendors in a professional and helpful manner in person, via phone or written correspondence.

● Strong organizational skills including the ability to manage multiple projects and details simultaneously.

● Some analytical ability to gather and summarize data, find solutions to various administrative problems, and prioritize work.

● Ability to develop and maintain recordkeeping systems and procedures.

● Ability to gather data, compile information, and prepare reports.

● Ability to develop, plan, and implement short- and long-term goals.

● Ability to work productively in a fast paced, stressful environment.

**Equipment, Machines and Software Used:**

This position requires the regular use of:

● Microsoft Office to include Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Gmail proficiency required.

● Automobile or small pickup truck for brand support travel.

**Mental Requirements:**

● Close mental and visual attention required to perform work dealing primarily with preparing and analyzing data and figures, communicating effectively with vendors, customers and coworkers, using a computer terminal, reading, writing and driving a vehicle.

**Physical Exertion:**

**Moderate work** - Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. Load and unload cases of product, set up products displays, lift, lower and move product at festivals, concerts, NYS Fair and other similar events.

**Environmental Conditions:**

Inside Work: Working inside dispensary’s and production facilities.

Outside Work: Walking between buildings and outside during brand support, photo shoots and samplings.

**Travel:**

This position does require frequent travel across NY state with an average of 4-5 days per week in market.

title: Parts Driver
description:
**Bergey’s Inc.**is a family-owned business that has been servicing our customers’ needs since 1924. Currently our company has over 50 locations and more than 1,700 team members. Today our family of automobile, truck and tire companies stretch throughout Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, & New Jersey. Visit us at **www.bergeys.com**to learn more about our company.



We strive to provide an environment for our associates and customers that is welcoming, transparent, and forward thinking. Our employees are our greatest asset. We promote and develop individual strengths, as well as grow our employees personally and professionally. Together we can make a difference.


**Benefits**:


**We offer a generous benefit package including:**


* Vacation and PTO time
* Paid Holidays
* 401k with profit sharing
* Medical, Dental and Vision insurance.
* Employee Assistant Program
* FSA and HSA Plans
* Life Insurance
* Opportunities for Advancement
* Paid Training
* Employee Referral Program
* Employee Discount


**Location: Bergey's Truck Center, Trenton NJ**


**Pay: Starting at $16.00 / hour based on experience**


**Shift: Full Time and Part Time positions available**

**Essential Duties:**


* Picks up and delivers parts and equipment to customers, satellite stores, wholesale accounts, and vendors.
* Checks with the parts manager, wholesale representative, inventory control administrator, parts counter people or shipping and receiving clerk before leaving to coordinate any last-minute pick-ups or deliveries.
* Checks with the body shop each day to determine immediate parts needs.
* Delivers parts to body shop when needed and distributes to appropriate body technicians.
* Verifies that invoice matches purchase order for each pick-up.
* Checks payments received with the invoices for each delivery.
* Keeps an accurate log of daily deliveries and pick-ups. Requests recipient's signature on each delivery entry.
* Unloads truck each night. Turns in all paperwork and undelivered parts.
* Handles basic maintenance of the truck including filling tank with gas, checking oil, keeping it clean and making sure required inspections are performed.
* Advises parts manager if delivery trucks need major repairs and maintenance.
* Helps maintain the professional appearance of the parts department.
* Assists service department as needed with attendant responsibilities of managing the drop-off and pick-up of customers' cars.
* Helps with stocking and posting orders when they arrive to expedite delivery to shop technicians and wholesale accounts.
* Other tasks as assigned.


**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations, Valid Driver's License**


* Valid Driver's License
* Must be 21 years old
* Successful completion of pre-employment background checks and drug screening.


**Bergey's is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
